entry.title: Fort Clinton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the New York City Board of Estimate voted to demolish Fort Clinton (pictured) six times before the fort became a U.S. national monument?

entry.title: 1947 World Snooker Championship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1947 World Snooker Championship was the first world snooker championship where the winner wasn't Joe Davis?

entry.title: Diana Hacker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to the Open Syllabus Project, Diana Hacker is the second most-read female author on college campuses after Kate L. Turabian?

entry.title: Alien: Covenant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a scene featuring Michael Fassbender kissing himself in Alien: Covenant was cut from the Chinese release due to censorship?

entry.title: Kommt herbei, singt dem Herrn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Kommt herbei, singt dem Herrn" is a Christian hymn that Diethard Zils wrote in 1972 as a paraphrase of Psalm 95 to an Israeli melody?

entry.title: Calais Conference of July 1915 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the Calais Conference of July 1915 both the British and French thought they had persuaded the other to support their opposing war strategies?

entry.title: Pipeline: The Surf Coaster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the seats on Pipeline: The Surf Coaster shift up and down to mimic the feeling of surfing?

entry.title: Ted Heaton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ted Heaton advertised himself as "Liverpool's famous swimming master"?
